As a senior engineer, your task is to maintain the project's context by analyzing this new commit.
    
    Here is the current project charter:
    {
  "initialized": true,
  "project_name": "Vibe Assist",
  "description": "A comprehensive code monitoring and security analysis tool that combines a Python AI backend (Daemon), a Next.js web application/API bridge, and a native macOS widget. The web application has been streamlined to function purely as a user-facing dashboard and an API endpoint for the widget, removing its previous role as a public marketing website. It provides real-time security vulnerability detection, AI-powered commit analysis, and proactive coding suggestions by monitoring git repositories and screen activity. The system's commit analysis functionality has been simplified to only process new commits that occur while the daemon is running, removing the capability to process a backlog of historical commits on startup. The system can also perform a one-time, lightweight analysis of a codebase to generate a baseline project context document, scanning all files except for a set of hardcoded common directories. The native macOS widget component has been simplified, removing decorative UI elements and auxiliary features like the menu bar launcher to focus on core data display.",

    "Python",

    "Turborepo",
    "pnpm"

    "apps/widget": "The native macOS widget written in Swift, which displays the final analysis results.",

{
  "project_name": "Vibe Assist",
  "description": "A comprehensive code monitoring and security analysis tool that combines a Python AI backend (Daemon), a Next.js web application/API bridge, and a native macOS widget. It provides real-time security vulnerability detection, AI-powered commit analysis, and proactive coding suggestions by monitoring git repositories and screen activity. The system's proactive screen analysis has been simplified to provide a continuous stream of suggestions without deduplication. The system can also perform a one-time, lightweight analysis of a codebase to generate a baseline project context document, scanning all files except for a set of hardcoded common directories. The native macOS widget component has been simplified, removing decorative UI elements and auxiliary features like the menu bar launcher to focus on core data display. prompt:
Analyze this commit to determine if it completes any of the project charter goals.

    Commit Message: commit vibes

    Commit Changes Summary:
    @@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 # Project Context: Vibe Assist
 
 ## Overview
-A comprehensive code monitoring and security analysis tool that combines a Python AI backend (Daemon), a Next.js web application/API bridge, and a native macOS widget. The web application has been streamlined to function purely as a user-facing dashboard and an API endpoint for the widget, removing its previous role as a public marketing website. It provides real-time security vulnerability detection, AI-powered commit analysis, and proactive coding suggestions by monitoring git repositories and screen activity. The system's commit analysis functionality has been simplified to only process new commits that occur while the daemon is running, removing the capability to process a backlog of historical commits on startup. The system can also perform a one-time, lightweight analysis of a codebase to generate a baseline project context document, scanning all files except for a set of hardcoded common directories. The native macOS widget component has been simplified, removing decorative UI elements and auxiliary features like the menu bar launcher to focus on core data display.
+A comprehensive code monitoring and security analysis tool that combines a Python AI backend (Daemon), a Next.js web application/API bridge, and a native macOS widget. It provides real-time security vulnerability detection, AI-powered commit analysis, and proactive coding suggestions by monitoring git repositories and screen activity. The system's proactive screen analysis has been simplified to provide a continuous stream of suggestions without deduplication. The system can also perform a one-time, lightweight analysis of a codebase to generate a baseline project context document, scanning all files except for a set of hardcoded common directories.
